alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Jefferson; Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Keokuk, southwestern Benton, northwestern Jefferson and western Iowa Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 318 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Brooklyn to 7 miles southwest of Ottumwa Industrial Airport. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Belle Plaine around 330 AM CDT. Luzerne around 335 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hedrick, Blairstown, Martinsburg and Hayesville. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 205 and 216. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
